multiple_choice_question.text: What do the equations (1.1) represent in the context of the paper "Construction of Algebraic Covers"?
choices: The equations defining the branch locus of a covering map.
The polynomials generating a sheaf of ideals defining the structure sheaf of a covering space.
The defining equations for the first syzygy module of a covering homomorphism.
The relations between the coefficients of the covering homomorphism and its first syzygy.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Theorem 3.3, what does the decomposition of ϕ∗OX as OY ⊕ M ⊕ M ⊕ ∧2M signify?
choices: The structure sheaf of a degree 3 Gorenstein covering space.
The decomposition of the first syzygy module of a Gorenstein covering map.
The structure sheaf of a degree 6 Gorenstein covering space.
The local ring at a ramification point of a Gorenstein covering map.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the equations (2.5) describe in the paper?
choices: A general linear transformation of a rank 2 vector bundle.
A covering homomorphism for a degree 3 covering map.
The first syzygy relations of a degree 3 covering homomorphism.
The defining equations for a triple cover of an algebraic variety.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the decomposition of Cᵗ in equation (3.2) illustrate?
choices: The structure of a general linear covering homomorphism for a degree 6 Gorenstein covering map.
The matrix representation of a linear transformation defining a degree 3 covering map.
The decomposition of the first syzygy module for a degree 6 covering homomorphism.
The structure of the ramification divisor for a degree 6 Gorenstein covering map.
